content.raw: There is a problem here, in that the constructor calls the valueFromString() method, but never checks the return value.  I'm not quite sure what to do about it; this is a real problem (the user could have passed us bogus information), but I'm not sure whether it is appropriate to throw an exception in the constructor.  Thoughts?
content.html: There is a problem here, in that the constructor calls the valueFromString() method, but never checks the return value. I'm not quite sure what to do about it; this is a real problem (the user could have passed us bogus information), but I'm not sure whether it is appropriate to throw an exception in the constructor. Thoughts?
